Over 8,000 S. Korean unionists fight for vital right 
    Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- At least 8,000 unionists under the Federation of South Korean Trade unions held a "national rally of workers" at the plaza of Seoul railway station on Sunday to denounce the suppression of workers and defend the right to existence, according to a CBS report from Seoul.
 After the rally they staged a demonstration up to the Myongdong Cathedral, scattering leaflets among citizens.

DPRK foreign minister leaves for Australia 
    Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- DPRK foreign minister Paek Nam Sun  and his party left here today to visit Australia.
 They were seen off at the airport by vice-minister of foreign affairs Choe Su Hon.

Agreement signed between DPRK and Nigeria
    Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- An agreement on bilateral cooperation in the fields of economy and technology was signed here yesterday between the DPRK Ministry of Foreign Trade and the Gombe state government of the Federal Republic of Nigeria.
